perturbation.original_text: Sponsor will be the exclusive retail music store sponsor of the Excite Site and the Excite Broadcast Pages. Excite will not permit the display of advertising banners, promotional buttons, promotional links or other promotional materials for any retail sale of Music Products on the Excite Site, except those Music Products offered by Sponsor, nor advertising by any other Retail Music Store. "Retail Music Store" shall mean any entity which is primarily engaged in the sale of Music Products at retail to consumers. "Music Products"
perturbation.changed_text: N2K Inc. will be the exclusive retail music store sponsor of the Excite Site and the Excite Broadcast Pages. Excite will not permit the display of advertising banners, promotional buttons, promotional links or other promotional materials for any retail sale of Music Products on the Excite Site, except those Music Products offered by the Licensee, nor advertising by any other Retail Music Store. "Retail Music Store" shall mean any entity which is primarily engaged in the sale of Music Products at retail to consumers. "Music Products"
perturbation.explanation: Changing "Sponsor" to "N2K Inc." in the first sentence, but then referring to 'Licensee' later, introduces ambiguity. It's unclear if 'Licensee' and 'N2K Inc.' are the same, potentially invalidating the exclusivity granted to Sponsor and creating enforcement uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
Each Co-Branded Page will display the name and/or brands of Sponsor and Excite.

Sponsor and Excite will collaborate on the "look and feel" of the Co-Branded Pages including, but not limited to, the display, appearance and placement of the parties' respective names and/or brands and of advertising displayed on the Co-Branded Pages. Excite will have final approval over the "look and feel" of the Co-Branded Pages, which approval will not be unreasonably withheld.
perturbation.changed_text:
Each Co-Branded Page will display the name and/or brands of N2K Inc. and Excite.

Music Boulevard and Excite will collaborate on the "look and feel" of the Co-Branded Pages including, but not limited to, the display, appearance and placement of the parties' respective names and/or brands and of advertising displayed on the Co-Branded Pages. Excite will have final approval over the "look and feel" of the Co-Branded Pages, which approval will not be unreasonably withheld.
perturbation.explanation: Using 'N2K Inc.' in the first sentence, but then using Music Boulevard, which is the sponsor's website, in the second introduces ambiguity and creates doubt as to which entity is actually subject to the collaborative requirements. Does Music Boulevard represent N2K Inc., or is it a separate entity?

perturbation.original_text:
Sponsor will pay Excite a share of all gross margins Sponsor realizes on transactions, advertising, sponsorship, promotions and any other revenue generated during each year of the term of the Agreement on the Sponsor Site as a result of users referred from the Excite Site ("Total Revenue"), subject to the following conditions:

i)       "Gross margin" is defined as [****].
perturbation.changed_text:
N2K Inc. will pay Excite a share of all gross margins Music Boulevard realizes on transactions, advertising, sponsorship, promotions and any other revenue generated during each year of the term of the Agreement on the Sponsor Site as a result of users referred from the Excite Site ("Total Revenue"), subject to the following conditions:

i)       "Gross margin" is defined as [****].
perturbation.explanation: The text states that 'N2K Inc.' will pay Excite a share of gross margins Music Boulevard realizes. It then defines 'gross margin' without clarifying whether the definition applies to N2K Inc., Music Boulevard, or both. This creates uncertainty regarding whose financial performance is being measured and how the 'gross margin' is to be calculated for the purposes of revenue sharing.
